field_description.value: Report directly to your CDX data flows.

field_settings_menu_items.second: US EPA CDX Help Desk

What is My Reporting?
The My Reporting app appears if you have a role as an EPA Central Data Exchange (CDX) user. For example, if you need to report data to the Compliance and Emissions Data Reporting Interface (CEDRI), a link along with your role will be shown.

What's included in My Reporting?
Right now, My Reporting includes just links to My CDX, to give you a quick way to access many EPA (and state and tribal applications in the future) in one spot.

What if there's a mistake in the list I see in My Reporting?
If you see a mistake, please contact the CDX Help Desk directly.

field_description.value: Be Well Informed provides feedback about the most common contaminants that affect wells.

field_settings_menu_items.second: Be Well Informed provides feedback about the most common contaminants that affect wells.

How does Be Well Informed work?
If you're a private well owner (i.e., your water comes from a well), we recommend you test your well water for pollutants every 3 to 5 years. If you do, you'll receive a lab report with findings, such as which elements and bacteria were found, if any. Be Well Informed asks for information from those lab reports and uses that information to evaluate your water quality and provide recommendations about water treatment options, if needed.
Why do I need to select a state? What if my state isn't listed?
Massachusetts, Michigan, and New Hampshire have told us what levels their state considers harmful for things like chloride, copper, and lead in well water. If your state isn't listed, you can still try Be Well Informed. The levels at which things like fluoride and lead are considered harmful in your drinking water differs from state to state. Your state's thresholds may vary slightly from the states included now, but it can still give you an idea of what to consider. Want your state to participate? Let us know (link to feedback form?) and we'll let them know you're interested.
I wasn't worried about my water quality, but should I be?
Not necessarily. Your well water may be fine. It's good to know for sure by testing it periodically as soil conditions change over time and can affect your well water.
Where do I find the values requested?
When you have your water tested, your test results will be summarized in the form of a lab report. This lab report will report elements and bacteria present in your water. If your report does not include those, it may not be present in your area, so just skip those spots in the form.
Do I need to enter all the values here?
You don't need to enter everything. The more information you include from your well water lab report, the more accurate the evaluation of your well water quality, and, if advisable, water treatment options. Regardless of water treatment technology, it is essential that your treatment system is maintained on schedule in order for it to work properly.

Information provided by the participating States is for informational purposes only. It is recommended that you consult a qualified water treatment professional if you need to treat your water. They can consider other conditions or factors related to your well or home to determine the most appropriate water treatment option.

field_settings_menu_items.second: Find new Notices of Intent (NOIs) under the U.S. EPA 2015 Multi-Sector General Permit (MSGP) submitted as of April 1, 2018. At this time, search results will only include new activity with the national NPDES eReporting Tool (NeT-MSGP) for U.S. EPA lead and participating states and tribes.

What permits can I find?

At this time, search results will only include new activity for the following permits as reported in the national NPDES eReporting Tool (NeT) for U.S. EPA lead and participating states and tribes. For additional information about which submissions are currently made through NeT please visit the NPDES E-reporting Program

• Construction General Permit (CGP):
Find Notices of Intent (NOIs), Notices of Termination (NOTs), or Low Erosivity Waivers (LEWs) submitted under the U.S. EPA 2017 Construction General Permit (CGP) in NET-CGP.
• Multi-Sector General Permit (MSGP):
Find new Notices of Intent (NOIs) under the U.S. EPA 2015 Multi-Sector General Permit (MSGP) submitted as of April 1, 2018 in NET-MSGP.

What do the permit statuses mean?

Active:
General permit coverage that has been granted by the NPDES permitting authority. Typically, a Notice of Intent (NOI) or request for exclusion or waiver that has been certified, submitted, reviewed (as applicable) and approved by the NPDES permitting authority.
Administratively Continued:
An active general permit coverage that has been extended to remain in force and effect for activities and discharges that were covered prior to expiration of the general permit.
Expired:
A general permit coverage, exclusion or waiver that has reached the end of the original issuance period, and for which requirements to submit a notice to renew coverage were not satisfied. In most cases, General Permits are issued for Five year periods.
Terminated:
A general permit coverage that has been terminated. Terminations can be requested by submitting a Notice of Termination (NOT) request for active general permit coverages. Coverage can also be terminated by the NPDES permitting authority.
Discontinued:
A certified exclusion or waiver from general permit coverage that has been discontinued. Discontinuations can be requested by submitting a Notice of Termination (NOT) request for active general permit coverages. Exclusions and waivers can also be discontinued by the NPDES permitting authority.
Under Review:
A Notice of Intent (NOI) for a new coverage, a modification request or Notice of Termination (NOT) request for existing coverage, or an exclusion/waiver request that has been submitted to the NPDES permitting authority and is currently undergoing review before decision to approve or deny the coverage request.
Inactive:
A Notice of Intent (NOI) for a new coverage or an exclusion/waiver request that has been submitted to the NPDES permitting authority and has been denied coverage under the general permit.

body.value:
On This Page

  • Logging In
  • General

Logging In

  • If I don't have an account, how can I use E-Enterprise?

    You can try E-Enterprise before using it, by selecting the Browse as Guest option on the Welcome page. You'll be able to use different widgets, including air quality and mapping widgets. If you need to submit, check, or review environmental data for a business or agency, you'll want to log in with your agency or CDX account credentials to see additional widgets, like a To Do list, Progress Tracker, Facility Management list, and others.

  • When I log in using my Facebook credentials, what information is being sent to the E-Enterprise Portal?

    The default behavior of Facebook is to share email and basic profile information, however, the E-Enterprise Portal only uses your email address.

  • How do I update my log-in password or email address?

    Password changes or email updates must be done through the provider for which your log-in credentials are associated (e.g., Facebook, CDX). The E-Enterprise Portal does not maintain this information.

General

  • How do I contact the E-Enterprise Portal Help Desk?

    Use the "Questions?" function within the portal to send questions/comments to the Help Desk. If you need immediate support, you can contact the Help Desk at 888-890-1995. 

  • How do I get additional information about the status of my Lead-based paint application beyond what is displayed in the 'Progress Tracker?'

    If you have specific questions about the status of your Lead application, please contact the Lead Hotline at 1-800-424-LEAD [5323].

  • What are the system requirements for using the E-Enterprise Portal?

    You will need:

    • Internet access
    • JavaScript enabled web browser
    • Pop-ups allowed in your browser to view modals and maps

    Supported Browsers:

    • Internet Explorer 11 or above
    • Mozilla Firefox 40.0.3 or above
    • Google Chrome 45.0.2454.93m or above
    • Safari 8 or above

    Screen Resolution:

    • Screen resolution should be set to 1024 x 768 or greater

General Resources

  • Introduction to the E-Enterprise Portal
  • E-Enterprise Portal Service Development Considerations and Lessons Learned
  • E-Enterprise Portal User Guide

App Resources

  • Download All (ZIP File)
  • Instructions
  • Template for Adding Resources
  • Assistance Gateway API

  • Download All (ZIP File)

Instructions

  • Onboarding Kit
  • Treatment Options (PDF)
  • Treatment Order (PDF)

Sample Flowchart and Results XML Files

  • Massachusetts (MA) - Flowchart • Results 
  • New Hampshire (NH) - Flowchart • Results
  • Wyoming (WY) - Flowchart • Results • Partner Agreement
  • E-Enterprise BWI Service Testing Checklist (XLS)

Help Desk & Service Level Integration

  • Be Well Informed-CDX Help Desk Diagrams (PPT)
  • E-Enterprise Portal CDX Help Desk Information (DOC)
  • Be Well Informed Service Level Information (XLS)
  • E-Enterprise Portal Service Level Information (XLS)

field_html.value: Report directly to your CDX data flows.
Save links you find in E-Enterprise to return to them later.

Have a well and wonder what your water testing results mean?

Be Well Informed lets you enter your test results and get feedback about health concerns and water treatment choices. Be Well Informed includes useful information about the most common contaminants that affect wells.

A quick disclaimer before we start: Information provided by the participating States is for informational purposes only. It is recommended that you consult a qualified water treatment professional if you need to treat your water. They can consider other conditions or factors related to your well or home to determine the most appropriate water treatment option.

Modeled After: New Hampshire’s Be Well Informed Guide

Version 2.0

  • Release date: TBD
  • Migration to Drupal 8 and Vue.js framework.
  • Redesign of widget / app architecture and interactions.

Version 1.27.01

Release date: February 23, 2018

Assistance Gateway: Enhancements to user experience. Performance enhancements.

Version 1.26.04

Release date: January 26, 2018

Various enhancements and refinements to improve usability.

Version 1.25.00

Release date: September 5, 2017

Various enhancements and refinements to improve usability.

Version 1.24.00

Release date: July 27, 2017

  • Various enhancements and refinements to improve usability

Version 1.23.00

Release date: June 9, 2017

  • Various enhancements and refinements to improve usability

 

Version 1.22.00

Release date: March 15, 2017

  • Various enhancements and refinements to improve usability

Version 1.21.00

Release date: February 14, 2017

  • Construction General Permit: Completed the initial widget functionality and integration
  • Established the new e-enterprise.gov landing page
  • To Do and Progress Tracker: Added "Last Updated" timestamp on each widget
  • Profile - Locations: Various improvements to inputting and searching for specific locations

 

Version 1.20.00

Release date: January 24, 2017

  • Favorite Links: Corrected an issue that would trigger a JavaScript error in the browser upon removing a single favorited link 
  • My Facility Manager: Tweaked 'Back to Edit Facility' link in the facility widget for usability
  • Developers' Area: Created a new repository of information relevant to developers
  • GitHub Integration: Added 'GitHub' link in the footer to the E-Enterprise Portal GitHub space

 

Version 1.19.00

Release date: January 3, 2017

  • Questions Modal: 'Email' field is now editable when accessing the modal from the 'New to E-Enterprise?' screen
  • To Do/Progress Tracker: Implemented single sign-on (SSO) separate from the 'Facility Widget;' corrected the styling of the 'Status' and 'Details' pop-up windows; corrected an issue that blocked the filter drop-down menus from being reachable
  • Widget Resizing: Updated all widgets to resize to fit the content displayed
  • Resources for Local Communities: Updated the sorting functionality to be consistent with other Portal widgets; corrected an issue with the favorite hearts not generating immediately on all resources pages but the first; added resources for Missouri Department of Natural Resources via the MO DNR API
  • Enviromapper: Corrected an issue where clicking the 'Update Contents on Map' button was not functional
  • Trending Air: Updated the Portal calls to Village Green to occur only once per site ID, per minute, across users
  • Facility Widget: Updated the 'My Facility Manager' to time out with the Portal rather than timing out independently
  • Profile - Interests: Corrected an issue where 'Community Type' was not saving when edited by a user

Version 1.18.00

Release date: November 22, 2016

  • Log-in Performance: The time between authenticating on log-in and loading the workbench improved
  • Resources for Local Communities: Additional resources added; issues with overlapping favorite hearts and duplicate 'Your Selections' options resolved
  • Enviromapper: Error when clicking a facility link on a map pop-up window resolved
  • Profile Favorites: Issue with ampersands in profile favorites causing errors resolved
  • Section 508/Timeout: Added code to alert the user to the impending timeout of the Portal
  • ForeSee Modal: Issue preventing the ForeSee modal from displaying resolved
  • To Do/Progress Tracker: Reworked to improve performance; CEDRI part codes, sub-part codes, and report types are now auto-discovered based on table content; issues with page numbers, column sorting, and filters not functioning resolved

Version 1.17.00

Release date: October 28, 2016

  • Facebook Authentication: Method updated to avoid using a link attribute to identify provider type
  • WAM/LAN Authentication: Updated the user authorization page to be consistent with the Exchange Network log-in page language and styling
  • Set Location: Field is not consistent across browsers and no longer cuts off the bottom of the city name in some browsers
  • Resources for Local Communities: Implemented functionality to allow resources to be associated with multiple items in each facet; corrected the ordering of the 'High,' 'Medium,' and 'Low' facet options for the 'Training Level' and 'Data Requirements' facets; resolved an issue where no topic options were displayed in the sidebar on the 'My Resources' tab after selecting interests on the new user 'Getting Started' screen; added a tool-tip to describe the widget and its purpose
  • My Facility Manager: An issue where some users were not seeing the widget on the workbench has been resolved

Version 1.16.01

Release date: October 12, 2016

  • Resolved an issue affecting Twitter, WAM, and PIV Card users where an error was generated regarding the user not having permission to edit the hidden Profile email field.
  • Updated the Profile to keep the user on the edited tab of the Profile upon saving.

Version 1.16.00

Release date: September 30, 2016

  • Federal Lead-based Paint Program: Bypass E-Enterprise Portal log-in and navigate directly to the Portal, via a link, after submitting an application in the Lead program
  • Landing Page: Interface design updates
  • Getting Started: Topics of interest options added to the first time users modal
  • Log-in: 'EPA LAN/WAM ID' and 'PIV Smart Card' providers added
  • Profile - Interests tab: Select topics of interest to dynamically update content in the 'My Resources' tab of the 'Resources for Local Communities' widget
  • Trending Air: Chicago, IL air monitor added
  • Resources for Local Communities - beta version: View local government resources and filter content via faceted search options
  • Section 508 Compliance: Improved screen reader functionality and keyboard accessibility

Version 1.08.00

Release date: April 21, 2016

  • Location management: Ability to add tribal areas
  • Progress Tracker: Logos now provided for approved Lead RRP and Combination applications, and status notes now reflect the date when applications are received and approved
  • CIO.gov design standard improvements
  • Section 508 compliance updates

Version 1.00.00

Release date: October 1, 2015

  • Dynamic content based on the following user types: Guest, CDX, and Public (Facebook, Twitter)
  • Location preference management
  • To Do List: Submission review tasks for state reviewers for the Compliance and Emissions Data Reporting Interface (CEDRI) program
  • Progress Tracker: Submission status tracking for CDX Lead and CEDRI industry submitters
  • My Facility Manager: View and edit capabilities for CEDRI, Chemical Safety and Pesticide Programs (CSPP), and eDisclosure submitters
  • My Air: Air quality data and map for specified locations
  • Trending Air: Village Green air monitoring station data
  • My Environment Mapper: View air, water, land, community, health, energy, and other data on a map
  • Interactive Maps: View and interact with various air, water, and land maps
  • Favorite Links: Favorite and save links of interest

Title: Get All Assistance Gateway Resources

This is the definition of the RESTful web service that E-Enterprise partners should expose in order to share real time resource information.

URL (path only, no root url)

/AssistanceGateway

Method

GET

URL Params

None. Method is expected to return all resources that the E-Enterprise partner wishes to expose through the service.

Data Params (for POST)

None. POST is not currently supported.

Success Response

Code: 200

Content:

{"resources": [
     {"topics": ["Emerging Technologies, Issues and Topics", "Stormwater"],
      "name":"Sustainable Communities",
      "link":"https://www.sustainablecommunities.gov/",
      "source":"Partnership for Sustainable Communities",
      "detailed_description":"On June 16, 2009, the U.S. Department of Housing and Urban Development (HUD), U.S. Department of Transportation (DOT), and the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) joined together to help communities nationwide improve access to affordable housing, increase transportation options, and lower transportation costs while protecting the environment.",
      "summary":"Designed to help communities nationwide improve access to affordable housing, increase transportation options, and lower transportation costs while protecting the environment.",
      "categories": ["Sustainability", "Asset Management", "Financial Assistance", "Capacity Development"],
      "tool_type":"Guidance-Website",
      "update_frequency":"Frequently",
      "relevance": ["Public", "Policy"]
      "training_level":"Low",
      "user_friendly_rating":"Medium",
      "data_resource_requirements":"High",
     }
]}

Error Response

Code: 400 BAD REQUEST

Content (example):

{ error : "The url in the request could not be parsed." }

Code: 404 NOT FOUND

Content:

{ error : "The specified resource does not exist." }

This is a co-governed site with applications and information created by E-Enterprise partners (US EPA, States, Tribes and Territories). In proceeding and accessing U.S. Government information and information systems, you acknowledge that you fully understand and consent to all of the following:

  1. Unauthorized access, unauthorized use, or unauthorized attempts to upload or change information maintained on the Web site area are strictly prohibited and may be subject to criminal and civil prosecution.
  2. EPA and our E-Enterprise partners (State, Tribes and Territories) have posted information on this site as a convenience to the portal users. Although EPA and our E-Enterprise partners have made every attempt to ensure the accuracy of the information posted on this site, portal users should not rely on information relating to environmental laws and regulations posted on this site. Portal users are solely responsible for ensuring that they are in compliance with all relevant environmental laws and regulations.
  3. The Portal may provide links to other data systems. The warnings, disclaimers, and/or terms of use for the other systems apply when the user is interacting with another system through the Portal.
  4. Privacy and Security: The terms and explanations at the linked page apply to the use of this site: https://cdx.epa.gov/PrivacyNotice. However, this term is hereby amended with respect to the Portal: "All information submitted by visitors is voluntary except when a site user is logged in as a regulated entity."

However, this term is hereby amended with respect to the Portal: "All information submitted by visitors is voluntary except when a site user is logged in as a regulated entity."

The E-Enterprise for the Environment Portal is a new user-friendly web platform that will modernize the way the public, regulated community, and environmental co-regulators conduct environmental transactions and access web resources. EPA is working with states and tribes to develop an interoperable portal integrating data and functionality over time to create a dynamic tool for collaboration and innovation.

The E-Enterprise for the Environment Portal will:

  • Decrease the time and effort needed to perform transactions with EPA, tribal, state, and local governments
  • Provide a more consistent way for environmental agencies to interact with regulated entities and the public
  • Allow the regulated community and the public to discover the information that is important to them
